meanings.definition: A commoner or member of the lower social classes.
meanings.sent1: The plebeian worked hard to provide for his family.
meanings.sent2: The city was bustling with plebeians going about their daily lives.
meanings.sent3: The plebeian accidentally dropped his groceries, causing a comical scene.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the plebeian character symbolized the struggles of the working class.
meanings.sent5: The plebeian's humble origins made him relatable to many in the audience.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the common people.
meanings.sent1: The plebeian traditions were passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: She preferred plebeian food like burgers and fries over fancy cuisine.
meanings.sent3: The plebeian fashion trend of wearing socks with sandals amused the fashionistas.
meanings.sent4: His plebeian taste in music clashed with her more refined preferences.
meanings.sent5: The plebeian celebration brought the whole neighborhood together in joy.

meanings.sent1: The plebeian artwork was simple yet heartfelt.
meanings.sent2: Her plebeian manners sometimes shocked the upper-class guests.
meanings.sent3: The plebeian attempt at fine dining resulted in a hilarious disaster.
meanings.sent4: His plebeian speech was met with disdain by the aristocrats.
meanings.sent5: The plebeian decor of the room gave it a cozy, down-to-earth feel.
